text: William J. Frere was a farmer and state senator in Maryland. Frere represented Charles County, Maryland. Frere lived in Tompkinsville and was a farmer.The Country Gentleman, Luther Tucker & Son, 1912 "A Swamp that was Made a Farm", page 6 He was a sponsor of the failed Digges Amendment. Frere was a Democrat.The Johns Hopkins University Studies in Historical and Political Science https://books.google.com/books?id=FXknAQAAIAAJ Herbert Baxter Adams, John Martin Vincent - 1969 ==References== Category:American farmers Category:History of racism in Maryland Category:Maryland Democrats Category:Maryland state senators Category:People from Charles County, Maryland
title: William J. Frere
